members.member: Specifies the size of the structure, in bytes.
This member can be one of the following flags: PI_NOUI or PI_APPLYPOLICY
Pointer to the name of the user. This member is used as the base name of the directory in which to store a new profile.
Pointer to the roaming user profile path. If the user does not have a roaming profile, this member can be NULL.
Pointer to the default user profile path. This member can be NULL.
Pointer to the name of the validating domain controller, in NetBIOS format. If this member is NULL, the Windows NT 4.0-style policy will not be applied.
Pointer to the path of the Windows NT 4.0-style policy file. This member can be NULL.
Handle to the HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry key.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.PrisonExecutor.BuildEnvironmentVariable(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Formats a string with the env variables for CreateProcess Win API function. See env format here: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms682653(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.PrisonManager.ReadAllPrisonsNoAttach
member.summary:
Loads all persisted Prison instances.
Prison objects are stored in the system folder, in a directory named 'windows-prison-db'. This is usually 'c:\windows\system32\windows-prison-db'.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.PrisonUserProfile.UnloadUserProfile
member.summary: This should be a replacement for UnloadUserProfile (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb762282%28v=vs.85%29.aspx) UnloadUserProfile cannot be invoked because the hProfile handle may not be available.

member.summary: Initialize the quota for every volume on the system.

member.summary: Gets a object that manages the quota for a specific user on a specific volume.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Allowances.Httpsys.AddPortAccess(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Allow access to the URL with the specified port for the specified username. This will allow IIS HWC and IIS Express to bind and listen to that port.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Allowances.Httpsys.RemovePortAccess(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Remove access for the specified port.
member.param: True if you want an exception to be thrown if there was an error, false otherwise.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Restrictions.Network.CreateOutboundThrottlePolicy(System.String,System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the limit for the upload network data rate. This limit is applied for the specified user. This method is not reentrant. Remove the policy first after creating it again.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Restrictions.Network.CreateOutboundThrottlePolicy(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the limit for the upload network data rate. This limit is applied for a specific server URL passing through HTTP.sys. This rules are applicable to IIS, IIS WHC and IIS Express. This goes hand in hand with URL Acls. This method is not reentrant. Remove the policy first after creating it again.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.PrisonConfiguration.TotalPrivateMemoryLimitBytes
member.summary: The total amount of commit memory available to the processes in the Prison.

member.summary: The total amount of CPU (as a percentage) available to the processes in the Prison.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.PrisonConfiguration.ActiveProcessesLimit
member.summary: The total number of processes that can run at the same time in the Prison.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.PrisonConfiguration.PriorityClass
member.summary: The priority class for the job object.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.PrisonConfiguration.DiskQuotaBytes
member.summary: The space usage quota for VolumeRootPath. Use -1 to disable disk quota.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.PrisonConfiguration.PrisonHomeRootPath
member.summary: The path in the disk volume to apply quota on. Ex. "C:\dir" for volume "C:\"

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.PrisonConfiguration.NetworkOutboundRateLimitBitsPerSecond
member.summary: The limit for network data upload rate in bits per second. Policy not enforced for local traffic. Use -1 to disable network throttling. NetworkOutboundRateLimitBitsPerSecond

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.PrisonConfiguration.AppPortOutboundRateLimitBitsPerSecond
member.summary: The limit for network data upload rate in bits per second. Policy not enforced for local traffic. Use -1 to disable network throttling. NetworkOutboundRateLimitBitsPerSecond

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.PrisonConfiguration.UrlPortAccess
member.summary: Allows the prisson's user to bind to URLs with the specified port. URL bindings are needed for HTTP.sys access, e.g. IIS, IIS HWC, IIS Express. Use 0 to disable HTTP.sys port access.

member.name: T:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Logger

member.summary: The NLog.Logger object used for logging.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Logger.Fatal(System.String)
member.summary: Logs a fatal message. This indicates a really severe error, that will probably make the application crash.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Logger.Error(System.String)
member.summary: Logs an error message. This indicates an error, but the application may be able to continue.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Logger.Warning(System.String)
member.summary: Logs a warning message. This indicates a situation that could lead to some bad things.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Logger.Info(System.String)
member.summary: Logs an information message. The message is used to indicate some progress.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Logger.Debug(System.String)
member.summary: Logs a debug message. This is an informational message, that is useful when debugging.

member.summary: Logs a fatal message and formats it. This indicates a really severe error, that will probably make the application crash.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Logger.Error(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs an error message and formats it. This indicates an error, but the application may be able to continue.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Logger.Warning(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs a warning message and formats it. This indicates a situation that could lead to some bad things.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Logger.Info(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs an information message and formats it. The message is used to indicate some progress.

member.name: T:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.FirewallTools
member.summary:
A set of Windows Firewall tool.
NB: BLOCK rules have percedence/priority over ALLOW rules.
Note from http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc755191(v=ws.10).aspx : This type of rule explicitly blocks a particular type of incoming or outgoing traffic. Because these rules are evaluated before allow rules, they take precedence. Network traffic that matches both an active block and an active allow rule is blocked.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.FirewallTools.OpenPort(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Opens a firewall port.
member.param: the application to open the port to

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.FirewallTools.ClosePort(System.Int32)
member.summary: Closes a port

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.FirewallTools.OpenPortRange(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Opens a range of firewall ports

member.summary: Is a class that manages a Windows Job Object. Job Objects allows to group a number of processes and perform some aggregate operations. It is a good tool for enforcing resource sandboxing for processes.

member.summary: Queries the extended limit information.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.KillProcessesOnJobClose
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to kill the processes when the Job Object is closed.
member.value: true if [kill processes on job close]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.DieOnUnhandledException
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a process to die on an unhandled exception.
member.value: true if [die on unhandled exception]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.Name
member.summary: Gets the name assigned to this Job Object instance.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.AllowChildProcessesBreakaway
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether processes are allowed to create processes outside the Job Object.
member.value: true if [allow child processes breakaway]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.AlwaysBreakawayChildProcesses
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether child processes are not added to the Job Object.
member.value: true if [always breakaway child processes]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.ActiveProcessesLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the active processes in the Job Object. Set to 0 (zero) to disable the limit.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.ProcessMemoryLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the memory in bytes limit enforced per process. Set to 0 (zero) to disable the limit.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.CPUPercentageLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage of CPU cycles allowed to be used by all processes in the JobObject. Should be a value between 0 and 100. Set to 0 (zero) to disable the limit.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.JobMemoryLimitBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the memory limit in bytes of the entire Job Object. Set to 0 (zero) to disable the limit.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.ProcessUserTimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the process user time limit. It is enforced per process. Set to 0 (zero) to disable the limit.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.JobUserTimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the Job Object user time limit. Every process user time is accounted. Set to 0 (zero) to disable the limit.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.PriorityClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority class of the Job Object.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.SchedulingClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the scheduling class of the JobObject.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.Affinity
member.summary: Gets or sets the processor affinity, enforced for every process.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.IOReadBytes
member.summary: Gets the total IO bytes read by every process in the Job Object.

member.summary: Gets the total IO bytes written by every process in the Job Object.

member.summary: Gets the total IO bytes used in other operations by every process in the Job Object.

member.summary: Gets the IO read operations count preformed by every process in the Job Object.

member.summary: Gets the IO write operations count preformed by every process in the Job Object.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.IOOtherOperationsCount
member.summary: Gets the other IO operations count preformed by every process in the Job Object.

member.summary: Gets the peak memory in bytes used by the Job Object at any given time.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObject.PeakProcessMemory
member.summary: Gets the peak memory in bytes used by a process.

member.summary: Gets the total processor time used by each process.

member.summary: Gets the user processor time used by each process.

member.name: T:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObjectHandle
member.summary: A safe handle for Job Object.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObjectHandle.#ctor
member.summary: Prevents a default instance of the class from being created.

member.name: M:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.JobObjectHandle.ReleaseHandle
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, executes the code required to free the handle.
member.returns: true if the handle is released successfully; otherwise, in the event of a catastrophic failure, false. In this case, it generates a releaseHandleFailed MDA Managed Debugging Assistant.

member.name: T:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.NativeMethods.JOBOBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_INFORMATION
member.summary: JOBOBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_INFORMATION Windows API structure.

member.name: F:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.NativeMethods.JOBOBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_INFORMATION.ControlFlags
member.summary: Control Flags.

member.name: F:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.NativeMethods.JOBOBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_INFORMATION.CpuRate
member.summary: CPU rate.

member.name: F:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.NativeMethods.JOBOBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_INFORMATION.Weight
member.summary: CPU rate weight.

member.name: F:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.NativeMethods.JOBOBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_INFORMATION.CpuRateControlFlags.JOB_OBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_ENABLE
member.summary: This flag enables the job's CPU rate to be controlled based on weight or hard cap. It must be set if JOB_OBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_WEIGHT_BASED or JOB_OBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_HARD_CAP is set. Source: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/hh448384(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: F:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.NativeMethods.JOBOBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_INFORMATION.CpuRateControlFlags.JOB_OBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_WEIGHT_BASED
member.summary: The job's CPU rate is calculated based on its relative weight to the weight of other jobs. If this flag is set, the Weight member contains more information. If this flag is clear, the CpuRate member contains more information. Source: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/hh448384(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: F:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.NativeMethods.JOBOBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_INFORMATION.CpuRateControlFlags.JOB_OBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_HARD_CAP
member.summary: The job's CPU rate is a hard limit. After the job reaches its CPU cycle limit for the current scheduling interval, no threads associated with the job will run until the next interval. Source: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/hh448384(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: F:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsJobObjects.NativeMethods.JOBOBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_INFORMATION.CpuRateControlFlags.JOB_OBJECT_CPU_RATE_CONTROL_NOTIFY
member.summary: The system will send a JOB_OBJECT_MSG_NOTIFICATION_LIMIT message to the job's I/O completion port if the job exceeds the CPU rate control limits specified in this structure within the tolerance specified in the JOBOBJECT_NOTIFICATION_LIMIT_INFORMATION structure. Source: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/hh448384(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: T:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsUsersAndGroups
member.summary: This is a helper class for managing Windows Users and Groups.

member.summary: Creates a Windows user.

member.summary: Creates a Windows user.

member.summary: Deletes the user.

member.summary: Verify if the user exists.

member.summary: Gets all the existing windows groups.

member.summary: Creates a Windows group.

member.summary: Deletes the group.

member.summary: Adds a user to a group.

member.summary: Removes a user from a group.

member.summary: Determines whether [is user member of group] [the specified user name].
member.returns: true if [is user member of group] [the specified user name]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CloudFoundry.WindowsPrison.Utilities.WindowsUsersAndGroups.Users
